title.narrative: Accelerating Green Growth in Ethiopia - II

description.narrative: Over the past decade, Ethiopia’s economy has grown rapidly and consistently, which has allowed the country to make significant reductions in poverty. Ethiopia’s development gains and future sustained growth, however, face threats due to climate change and environmental challenges including: Domestic food insecurity due to dependence on rain-fed agriculture. Energy insecurity due to reliance on rainwater for hydropower-generated electricity. Greenhouse Gas (GHG) emissions that pose a long term economic liability.
Support the Government of Ethiopia’s deliverables relating to development goals by integrating CRGE plans and projects into Ethiopia’s Second Growth and Transformation Plan.

participating-org.narrative: Italian Ministry of Environment and Land and Sea (IMELS)

mailing-address.narrative: Global Green Growth Institute, 19F Jeongdong Bldg., 21-15 Jeongdong-gil, Jung-gu Seoul 04522 Republic of Korea

title.narrative: "Accelerating Green Growth" - Project Results Report
South-South Cooperation and Knowledge Sharing strategy developed and implementation commenced

description.narrative: A strategy document on climate diplomacy is developed and submitted to the government with the support of GGGI. Also, GGGI organized several high-level South-South Cooperation events to provide political leadership in the framework of Paris Agreement Work Program (PAWP).

title.narrative: At least one (1) Strategy Developed
Comprehensive MRV system for the CRGE developed

description.narrative: As one of few countries that boldly embarked on green growth development path, Ethiopia has lessons to share from its own bold initiatives and can gain experiences from other countries efforts. With regards to South-South Cooperation (SSC), the following knowledge sharing activities were achieved in 2018: - SSC Strategy Concept Note - Support for establishment of GGGI’s Regional Office in Addis Ababa - Additional Engagements/Participation (convened by the African Union) o Second AU Symposium on Special Economic Zones in Africa organized from 21-22 November 2018 o Financing Industrialization o Africa Free Zone Organization (AFZO) Workshop, Accra, Ghana, 12th December 2018

title.narrative: MRV system developed and functional
Improved tracking of climate expenditure

description.narrative: At least one end-user’s capacity built to use the tracking system

title.narrative: At least one (1) end user's capacity built to use the tracking system
Financing is approved for CRGE supported proposals

description.narrative: Financing is approved for five proposals submitted

title.narrative: Financing is approved for 5 proposals submitted worth cs. $500 million
Sector-wide System for tracking climate expenditure developed

description.narrative: Five(+) investment proposals are developed, which are following: 1. Industrial Parks/Industrial Parks Development Corporation (IPDC) 2. CRGE Facility (MoF): 3. Water 4. Green Climate Fund (GCF) Engagement 5. Forestry & Agriculture: 6. LDC Group/Climate Diplomacy 7. Cooperation with Government of Italy

title.narrative: At least one (1) sector-wide tracking system developed to track climate expenditure
Bankable public/private project developed and capacity built

description.narrative: GGGI co-convened a 2-day high-level consultative workshop on “Enhancing Capacity of Ethiopia to Address Climate Change by Focusing on Forestry and MRV Issues”. Following the outcomes of the workshop, and in collaboration with EFCCC’s MRV directorate, GGGI co-convened an MRV consultative workshop for the development of a two-year MRV implementation roadmap for 2019-2020.

title.narrative: At least five (5) investment proposals are developed worth ca. 500 million USD
Financial requirement and options for full implementation of the CRGE/INDC analyzed

description.narrative: GGGI developed a sector-wide system for tracking climate investment and finance for Ethiopia’s Transport and Urban sectors. The finalized tracking system(s) for Urban and Transport sectors shall be shared for approval in an expert group validation workshop convened by the GRGE Advisory Board and the CRGE Facility (MoF). Upon approval, awareness-raising on utilization of the tracking system will be conducted for select, relevant stakeholders.

title.narrative: Analysis report completed and submitted - includes Quantified Sectorial Financing Requirements, Identified Sources of Financing, Capability of Financiers and Contribution Mix Quantified
MRV system for CRGE enhanced
Improved quality of GHG reporting
Improved knowledge sharing and communication related to climate diplomacy
Participants report an increase in green growth and climate diplomacy related knowledge and skills
Green Growth in Ethiopia accelerated

Sustaining rapid, broad based and equitable economic growth and development of 11% in real terms (GDP) Agriculture and Industrial output, value added of GDP [to be confirmed] Percentage of population living under national poverty line Annual CO2e emissions (metric tons per capita) [to be confirmed]
Improved understanding of financing requirements for CRGE
The financial analysis report is accepted by the government
